beer.beer_description:
Our Lemongrass Kolsch was brewed to reflect Kolsch beers originating from Cologne, Germany. Clean and crisp maltiness is complimented by a subtle yeast-driven fruitiness while the hops offer a herbaceous & floral undertone. Supreme drinkability will keep you coming back for more – this beer is the definitive German-inspired drinking experience. A bouquet of red apple and pineapple harmonises well with the light touch of lemongrass in this twist of a classic German Kolsch-styled beer. Pouring with a bright golden hue, the light wheat additions give a billowing foam crown that delivers further aromatic notes of bread crust and a light orange peel. On the backend, a mild but dignified bitterness balances well with the rounded sweetness from the malt. Overall, this brew delivers something both familiar and exotic; it’s incredibly approachable and endlessly refreshing!
Featuring "Lemon Zest" by returning artist Karen Lynch.

.










.



古来圣贤皆寂寞，惟有饮者留其名
Beer, it’s not just for breakfast anymore.
Drinky drinky, time for less thinky.
Love trying all the different beers, and dont mind a good scotch. Ratings are mine on style and taste for that style.

items.badge_description: Thanks for enjoying a beer at Hotel Sweeney's, make sure you check out the Rooftop while you're here. Keep drinking up through the untappd levels and make sure you show the bartenders when you reach levels 25 & 50 for your special gift.

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 160 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 33! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

items.checkin_comment: A super refreshing kolsch by some of my favourite Brisbane brewers, Aether. A little lemony as expected and so easy drinking.

items.badge_description: Celebrate women and non-binary individuals in craft beer! Every year the Pink Boots Society (PBS) hosts Collaboration Brew Day where teams come together to brew a collab beer that supports the PBS mission to support, inspire, and encourage the professional development of women and non-binary people in the industry. Learn more
The kölsch style has a rich heritage, originating in Cologne, Germany. It's clear, crisp, medium hopped flavors are always refreshing. Try 5 more for Level 2!

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 225 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 46!

It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That's 375 check-ins with a photo.  Try 5 more for Level 76!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 225 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 46!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 130 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 27!
